channel.title: BUpolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUpolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump administration in talks with Qatar over plane gift
item.description: A deal on a plane that would become Air Force One has not been reached, but ethics experts say accepting it from Qatar would violate the Constitution’...

item.title: White House fires head of Copyright Office amid Library of Congress shakeup
item.description: The White House terminated U.S. Copyright Office Director Shira Perlmutter two days after firing the Librarian of Congress.

item.title: U.S. officials say ‘substantial progress’ made in China trade talks
item.description: The White House said it was announcing a trade deal without providing any details. Representatives from the U.S. and China had been meeting in Switzer...

item.title: Why one man hopes tariffs give a boost to his Made in America Store
item.description: Outside Buffalo, you’ll find 18,000 square feet of stuff, all 100 percent made in the United States. But even the owner knows it’s hard to avoid forei...

item.title: Fake pizza orders sent to judges seen as threat to judicial safety
item.description: Amid legal challenges to the Trump administration, judges in at least seven states say they have received anonymous pizza deliveries seen as threats.

item.title: Vicious Venezuelan Gang Attacks Police in Times Square
item.description: A recent assault by Tren de Aragua members on NYPD officers in Times Square is yet another example of the abject failure of open borders and sanctuary...

item.title: Office of “New Americans” State Network Finally Fizzles after Fast Start
item.description: Beginning in the mid-2010s, a subsidiary of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA) convinced seven states to establish Office of New Amer...

item.title: Office of “New Americans” State Network Finally Fizzles after Fast Start
item.description: Beginning in the mid-2010s, a subsidiary of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA) convinced seven states to establish Office of New Amer...

item.title: Warren Buffett shocks shareholders by announcing his intention to retire at the end of the year
item.description: Earlier, Buffett warned Saturday about the dire global consequences of President Donald Trump's tariffs.

item.title: ‘Anything can happen’: Trump doesn't seem fazed by recession worries
item.description: Trump has blamed shaky economic numbers on his predecessor.

item.title: Democrats look to Trump's poor economic numbers with anxious optimism
item.description: Following its latest round of focus groups, Navigator Research is urging Democrats to proactively push their own economic policies.

item.title: German Court Allows Asylum Seekers to be Deported to Safe Countries
item.description: German courts have ruled that asylum seekers can be deported back to safe countries. To read the rest of the article click here The post German Court ...

item.title: Illegal Immigration: Texas, Florida Zeroing in on Health Care Costs
item.description: Willful blindness has been a strategy for many states when it comes to the costs of illegal immigration. Last year, Florida opted to take the blinders...

item.title: Warning signs for Trump as pessimistic outlook on the economy grows among Americans
item.description: Trump’s winning issue is becoming one of his biggest liabilities as multiple polls this week reveal growing disapproval numbers on the economy.

item.title: Trump, defiant on tariffs, claims trade deals are in the works
item.description: The president is foreshadowing deals with multiple trading partners in an apparent effort to quell economic anxiety and prove his tariff plan is worki...

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
